quotes.quote: They're being good citizens without the right to citizenship.
quotes.author: Hector Flores

quotes.quote: Our citizenship is in eternity; history is our temporary residence.
quotes.author: Erwin McManus

quotes.quote: No one is born a good citizen; no nation is born a democracy. Rather, both are processes that continue to evolve over a lifetime. Young people must be included from birth. A society that cuts off from its youth severs its lifeline.
quotes.author: Kofi Annan

quotes.quote: Citizenship is the chance to make a difference to the place where you belong.
quotes.author: Charles Handy

quotes.quote: Good citizenship would teach accuracy of thinking and accuracy of statement.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Every citizen of the republic ought to consider himself an unofficial policeman, and keep unsalaried watch and ward over the laws and their execution.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: What keeps a republic on its legs is good citizenship.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: A little citizenship ought to be taught at the mother's knee and in the nursery.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Where is the true Native American Spirit? It dwells in the breasts of our uncorrupted orators, in our yeomanry, in our sailors, and in our few remaining old patriots. Where dwells British influence? In our banks, in our warehouses, in our commerce.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: I feared much for your health when you went away. I must entreat you to be as careful as you can consistent with a duty you owe your country.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: So long as we are inhabitants of this earth and possess any of our faculties, we cannot be indifferent to the state of our country, our posterity, and our friends.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: There is little use for the being whose tepid soul knows nothing of the great and generous emotion, of the high pride, the stern belief , the lofty enthusiasm, of the men who quell the storm and ride the thunder.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Full citizenship must be given the coloured woman because she needs the ballot for her protection and that of her children,
quotes.author: Hallie Quinn Brown

quotes.quote: In the great fulfillment, we must have a citizenship less concerned about what the government can do for it and more anxious about what it can do for the nation.
quotes.author: Harry Hansen

quotes.quote: Let every American swear by the blood of the Revolution never to violate in the least particular the laws of the country and never to tolerate their violation by others.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: That's the difference between governments and individuals. Governments don't care, individuals do.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Stand against him in no spirit of vengeance, but only with the resolute purpose to make him act as decent citizens must act if this Republic is to be, and to be kept, what it shall become.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: My heart rules / The Kingdom of truth / And I am the King of Love / How equality, justice / And respect apply here? / One can enter and visit that / Only with a Visa of love / Sincerity can reward / Citizenship of that Kingdom / With all the rights.
quotes.author: Ehsan Sehgal

quotes.quote: A strict observance of the written laws is doubtless one of the high virtues of a good citizen, but it is not the highest. The laws of necessity, of self-preservation, of saving our country when in danger, are of higher obligation.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I think if the people of this country can be reached with the truth, their judgment will be in favor of the many, as against the privileged few.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Our citizenship in the United States is our national character. Our citizenship in any particular state is only our local distinction. By the latter, we are known at home, by the former to the world. Our great title is AMERICANS -- our inferior one varies with the place.
quotes.author: Paine

quotes.quote: If every single Jew born anywhere in the world has the right to become an Israeli citizen, then all the Palestinians who were chucked out of Palestine by the Zionist Government should have the same right, very simple.
quotes.author: Tariq Ali

quotes.quote: You are a citizen, and citizenship carries responsibilities.
quotes.author: Paul Collier

quotes.quote: I have no country to fight for: my country is the earth, and I am a citizen of the world.
quotes.author: Eugene V. Debs

quotes.quote: I realized that public affairs were also my affairs. I became active in politics because I saw the possibility if we all sat back and did nothing, of a world in which there would no longer be any stages for actors to act on.
quotes.author: Helen Gahagan Douglas

quotes.quote: A passive and ignorant citizenry will never create a sustainable world.
quotes.author: Andrew Gaines

quotes.quote: My country is the world; my countrymen are mankind.
quotes.author: William Lloyd Garrison

quotes.quote: The job of a citizen is to keep his mouth open.
quotes.author: Gunter Grass

quotes.quote: Since an informed citizenry is the basis for a healthy democracy, independent, non-corporate media are more crucial today than ever before.
quotes.author: Dahr Jamail

quotes.quote: The efforts of the government alone will never be enough. In the end, the people must choose and the people must help themselves.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Let us at all times remember that all American citizens are brothers of a common country, and should dwell together in bonds of fraternal feeling.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: It is strangely absurd to suppose that a million of human beings, collected together, are not under the same moral laws which bind each of them separately.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: What is a city, but the people; true the people are the city.
quotes.author: Coriolanus III

quotes.quote: We do not look in our great cities for our best moralit
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Cities are murky places--hatching grounds for monsters.
quotes.author: John Geddes

quotes.quote: All cities are mad: but the madness is gallant. All cities are beautiful, but the beauty is grim.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: This city now doth, like a garment, wear the beauty of the morning; silent bare, ships, towers, domes, theatres and temples lie open unto the fields and to the sky; All bright and glittering in the smokeless air.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.quote: Cities force growth, and make men talkative and entertaining, but they make them artificial.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Cities with all their advantages have something hostile to liberal learning, the seductions are so subtle and accost the senses so openly on all sides.
quotes.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quotes.quote: Cities have the capability of providing something for everybody, only because, and only when, they are created by everybody.
quotes.author: Jane Jacobs

quotes.quote: There is no solitude in the world like that of the big city.
quotes.author: Kathleen Norris

quotes.quote: A city that outdistances man's walking powers is a trap for man.
quotes.author: Arnold Joseph Toynbee

quotes.quote: Towered cities please us then, and the busy hum of men.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: The City attaches an exaggerated importance to the healing power of lunch.
quotes.author: Christopher Fieldes

quotes.quote: No city should be too large for a man to walk out of in a morning.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.quote: Cities get built out of poet's dreams.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: The pressure of survival in the big city will make you lose sight of your dream... Hang in there.
quotes.author: James De La Vega

quotes.quote: There's something about arriving in new cities, wandering empty streets with no destination. I will never lose the love for the arriving, but I'm born to leave.
quotes.author: Charlotte Eriksson

quotes.quote: The city gives even to children a sophisticated look that baffles the casual psychologist.
quotes.author: Honoré Willsie Morrow

quotes.quote: We are in danger of making our cities places where business goes on but where life, in its real sense, is lost.
quotes.author: Hubert Humphrey

quotes.quote: A city is a large community where people are lonesome together.
quotes.author: Herbert Prochnow

quotes.quote: The cities of the world are concentric, isomorphic, synchronic. Only one exists and you are always in the same one. It's the effect of their permanent revolution, their intense circulation, their instantaneous magnetism.
quotes.author: Jean Baudrillard

quotes.quote: The life of our city is rich in poetic and marvelous subjects. We are enveloped and steeped as though in an atmosphere of the marvelous; but we do not notice it.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: Man's course begins in a garden, but it ends in a city.
quotes.author: Alexander Maclaren

quotes.quote: I have never felt salvation in nature. I love cities above all.
quotes.author: Michelangelo Buonarroti

quotes.quote: A soulless city creates soulless people!
quotes.author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quotes.quote: The single most important thing a city can do is provide a community where interesting, smart people want to live with their families.
quotes.author: Malcolm Gladwell

quotes.quote: A city isn't so unlike a person. They both have the marks to show they have many stories to tell. They see many faces. They tear things down and make new again.
quotes.author: Rasmenia Massoud

quotes.quote: Any city however small, is in fact divided into two, one the city of the poor, the other of the rich. These are at war with one another.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: It's been amazing getting to go from city to city and perform for thousands of people. It's an amazing feeling, and the energy is crazy.
quotes.author: Austin Mahone

quotes.quote: We will neglect our cities to our peril, for in neglecting them we neglect the nation.
quotes.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quotes.quote: The city is a fact in nature, like a cave, a run of mackerel or an ant-heap. But it is also a conscious work of art, and it holds within its communal framework many simpler and more personal forms of art. Mind takes form in the city; and in turn, urban forms condition mind.
quotes.author: Lewis Mumford

quotes.quote: What I like about cities is that everything is king size, the beauty and the ugliness.
quotes.author: Joseph Brodsky

quotes.quote: It is in the midst of the city that one writes the most inspiring pages about the country.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: A city is a place where there is no need to wait for next week to get the answer to a question, to taste the food of any country, to find new voices to listen to and familiar ones to listen to again.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.quote: A large city cannot be experientially known; its life is too manifold for any individual to be able to participate in it.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: There is hardly one in three of us who live in the cities who is not sick with unused self.
quotes.author: Ben Hecht

quotes.quote: The great city is that which has the greatest man or woman: if it be a few ragged huts, it is still the greatest city in the whole world.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: Here in the big city people spend their time thinking about work and about money; they don't give some value to friendships and it can be depressing.
quotes.author: Adriana Lima

quotes.quote: Cities are the abyss of the human species.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.quote: Cities have always been the fireplaces of civilization, whence light and heat radiated out into the dark.
quotes.author: Theodore Parker

quotes.quote: All that a city will ever allow you is an angle on it -- an oblique, indirect sample of what it contains, or what passes through it; a point of view.
quotes.author: Peter Conrad

quotes.quote: The catalogue of forms is endless: until every shape has found its city, new cities will continue to be born. When the forms exhaust their variety and come apart, the end of cities begins.
quotes.author: Italo Calvino

quotes.quote: What strange phenomena we find in a great city, all we need do is stroll about with our eyes open. Life swarms with innocent monsters.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.quote: In a living city, I could never have noticed so much. Living cities don't hold still.
quotes.author: John Irving

quotes.quote: The city disappears street by street as you enter it.
quotes.author: Ian Seed

quotes.quote: But cities aren't like people; they live on and on, even though their reason for being where they are has gone downriver and out to sea.
quotes.author: John Updike

quotes.quote: Cities are the sinks of the human race.
quotes.author: Rousseau

quotes.quote: There's this thing of you can live in a city and be completely alone, not notice anything going on around you.
quotes.author: Simon Pegg

quotes.quote: A great city is not to be confounded with a populous one.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: To look at the cross-section of any plan of a big city is to look at something like the section of a fibrous tumor.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: Everybody's got haters, but your city's always behind you. It's only right to give back.
quotes.author: Stefon Diggs

quotes.quote: There is much to love and to admire in the great city. It is the home of the highest achievements of man and art, literature and science: the source from which the forces of freedom and emancipation have sprung. It is the place where the spirit of humanism and of democracy grown and flourished, were man's quest for knowledge and justice has been pursued most constantly, and truth revealed most faithfully and fearlessly.
quotes.author: William Robson

quotes.quote: Farewell! thou busy city, / Amid whose changing throng I’ve passed a pleasant sojourn, / Though wearisome and long. My soul is sad at leaving / The dear ones, not a few, / I've met within thy mazes, / So noble and so true.
quotes.author: Lucy Larcom

quotes.quote: Different cities boil within each of us. There is so much we hate — the dirt, the poverty, the prejudice; there is so much we love — the one or two friendships that somehow crossed boundaries, the libraries where we joined ourselves to the dreams of others, the places where we compose dreams of our own, the museums where we learned how to defeat time, certain streets, alleys staircases, apartment-house roofs, certain radio stations we would listen to deep into the night, certain newspapers we read as if they were a testament to the ages. We remember the terrors and joys of our early urban wanderings.
quotes.author: Chaim Potok

quotes.quote: The city, inhabited by these memories of mine, moves not only backwards into art history, started by the great names which mark every station of recorded time, but also back and forth in the living present, so to speak — among its contemporary faiths and races; the hundred little spheres which religion or lore creates and which cohere softly together like the cells to form the great sprawling jellyfish which is Alexandria today.
quotes.author: Lawrence Durrell

quotes.quote: The city is not all bad nor all good. It is humanity compressed, the best and the worst combined, in a strangely composite community.
quotes.author: Lyman Abbott

quotes.quote: A city has values as well as slums, excitement as well as conflict; it has a personality that has not yet been obliterated by its highways and gas stations; it has a spirit as well as a set of arteries and a voice that speaks the hopes as well as the disappointments of its people.
quotes.author: Charles Abrams

quotes.quote: Hail the glorious Golden City, / Pictured by the seers of old! / Everlasting light shines o'er it, / Wondrous tales of it are told.
quotes.author: Felix Adler

quotes.quote: Cities should be walled with the courage of their inhabitants.
quotes.author: Agesilaus the Second

quotes.quote: Everyone relies on the city and all the public services that it contains. If we have concluded rightly, from what the philosophers say, that cities owe their origin and their existence to their enabling their inhabitants to enjoy a peaceful life, as freed from any inconvenience or harm as possible, then surely the most thorough consideration should be given to the city's layout, site, and outline.
quotes.author: Leon Batista Alberti

quotes.quote: Not houses finely roofed or the stones of walls well-builded, nay nor canals and dockyards, make the city, bur men able to use their opportunity.
quotes.author: Alcaeus

quotes.quote: The city as from a tower, / Hospital, brothel, prison, and such hells. / Where evil comes up softly like a flower . . . . / I love thee, infamous city!
quotes.author: Nelson Algren

quotes.quote: A city is a place where people who are oppressed and who have lost hope can come.
quotes.author: Joseph L. Alioto

quotes.quote: The city is the teacher of the man.
quotes.author: Simonides

quotes.quote: The city is, in fact, the most important thing constituted by human reason.
quotes.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quotes.quote: Men come together in cities for security; they stay together for the good life.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: A city is a collective body of persons sufficient in themselves for all the purposes of life.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: A city, too, like an individual, has a work to do; and that city which is best adapted to the fulfillment of its work is to be deemed greatest.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Certainly our city — with the byres of poverty down to / The river's edge, the cathedral, the engines, the dogs; / Here is the cosmopolitan cooking / And the light allows and the glass. / Built by the conscious-stricken, the weapon-making. / By us.
quotes.author: W.H. Auden

quotes.quote: To build the City where / The will of love is done / And brought to its full flower / The dignity of man.
quotes.author: W.H. Auden

quotes.quote: Towns can be trusted to corrupt themselves.
quotes.author: Alfred Austin

quotes.quote: Every day in the city, on the contrary — and I grew up in the city — involves a subtle divorce from reality. There is something a little terrifying about being forty stories in the air and looking around you, and you see nothing but walls, other skyscrapers, and you don't dare look down. And if you are on the ground, if you want to see the sky, you must make an effort of the will and look up. And if you do that, you are likely to be carried off to Bellevue — but that is another story.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: No one in the city, except your immediate family — not always they— says good morning.
quotes.author: James Baldwin

quotes.quote: It is a great evil in the city that people are cut off from nature and communion with nature, so that they who would like to enjoy the sights and scenes and blessings of nature can do so only on rare occasions and by taking a journey.
quotes.author: Lord James Bryce

quotes.quote: The city is the only place where true diversity can thrive and where specialization can reach its apogee.
quotes.author: John Ely Burchard

quotes.quote: The essence of the ideal city is that a wide variety of individuals living in it have a clear chance to live a richly individualistic life if they want to; and I project this still further to include in the essence the stipulation that the humane city shall itself have individuality.
quotes.author: John Ely Burchard

quotes.quote: Our relations with cities are like our relations with people. We love them, hate them, or are indifferent toward them. On our first day in a city that is new to us, we go looking for the city. We go down this street, around that corner. We are aware of the faces of passers-by. But the city eludes us, and we become uncertain whether we are looking for a city, or for a person.
quotes.author: Victor Burgin

quotes.quote: Can the mind have a greater pleasure than contemplating the rise and progress of cities and kingdoms?
quotes.author: Andrew Burnaby

quotes.quote: The city, is constantly drawing from the country the young men and women of ambition and self-reliance, who are lured thither by the great prizes which in a democracy are open to the competition of all.
quotes.author: Daniel Burnham

quotes.quote: The observation that man thinks, feels, responds differently in the city than outside it is old as the city itself.
quotes.author: Don Martindale

quotes.quote: The theory of the city somehow cannot account for what every journalist, poet, and novelist knows — the city is a living thing.
quotes.author: Don Martindale

quotes.quote: There are moments in every city dawn when the circles, rectangles, polygons, and triangles — the geometry of the city — seem to float in the mist, like the essence of the human spirit emancipated from the earth. There are times, on starlit nights, when its towers and spires ram upward as if to tear the darkness loose from its riveting stars and the city seems to be a strident assertion of mankind against time itself.
quotes.author: Don Martindale

quotes.quote: The city has more wealth than the country, more skill, more erudition within its bounds, more initiative, more philanthropy, more science, more divorces, more aliens, more births and deaths, more accidents, more rich, more poor, more wise men and more fools.
quotes.author: William Munro

quotes.quote: The city magnifies, spreads out, and advertises human nature in all its various manifestations. It is this that makes the city interesting, even fascinating. It is this, however, that makes it of all places the one in which to discover the secrets of human hearts, and to study human nature and society.
quotes.author: Robert E. Park

quotes.quote: [The city] has always been the fireplace of civilization, whence light and heat radiated out into the dark.
quotes.author: Theodore Parker

quotes.quote: Yes, I went to the city / And there I did bitterly cry, / Men our of touch with the earth, / And with never a glance at the sky.
quotes.author: Kenneth Patchen

quotes.quote: The beautiful city, the city of hurried and sparkling waters! the city of spires and masts! / The city nested in bays! my city! / The city of such women, I am mad with them! I will return after death to be with them! / The city of such young men, I swear I cannot live happy, without I often go talk, walk, eat, drink, sleep, with them!
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote:
The only credential the city asked was the boldness to dream. For those who did, it unlocked its gates and its treasures, not
caring who they were or where they came from.
quotes.author: Moss Hart

quotes.quote: The city is itself a huge market. You can't go more than a few steps without finding a store of some sort. We are all potential entrepreneurs, looking to make a deal in this country of commerce.
quotes.author: Jerome Charyn

quotes.quote: For us who live in cities Nature is not natural. Nature is supernatural. Just as monks watched and strove to get a glimpse of heaven, so we watch and strive to get a glimpse of earth. It is as if men had cake and wine every day but were sometimes allowed common bread.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Our world is evolving without consideration, and the result is a loss of biodiversity, energy issues, congestion in cities. But geography, if used correctly, can be used to redesign sustainable and more livable cities.
quotes.author: Jack Dangermond

quotes.quote: He worked like hell in the country so he could live in the city, where he worked like hell so he could live in the country.
quotes.author: Don Marquis

quotes.quote: How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people! how is she become as a widow!
quotes.author: Bible (Jeremiah 1:1)

quotes.quote: Tuning the lyre and handling the harp are no accomplishments of mine, but rather taking in hand a city that was small and inglorious and making it glorious and great.
quotes.author: Themosticles

quotes.quote: God made the country, and man made the town.
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.quote: The city is not a concrete jungle, it is a human zoo.
quotes.author: Desmond Morris

quotes.quote: The country places and the trees won’t teach me anything, and the people in the city do.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: I come from suburbia . . . and I don’t ever want to go back. It’s the one place in the world that’s further away than anywhere else.
quotes.author: Frederic Raphael

quotes.quote: The modern city is a place for banking and prostitution and very little else.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote: There was a certain something about the air in the city. You got the feeling that it was air that had seen life. You couldn’t help noting with every breath that thousands of other people were very close to you and nearly all of them had armpits.
quotes.author: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote: Baby this town rips the bones from your back / It’s a death trap, it’s a suicide rap
quotes.author: Bruce Springsteen

quotes.quote: The really great visual experience today is to fly over a huge city and look down into the night. It's like a tremendous jubilant Christmas tree. You just feel life is worth living — when you come down you may have some doubts.
quotes.author: Gyocgy Kepes

quotes.quote: But maybe I too have been stuck in this bad marriage too long, hopelessly in love not with the city, the hard economic realities of it, the years of being part of the crowd, but with the skyline, that suggestion in lights that this place is both unreachable and a goal. That it is, in short, poetry. That is the city that pulls me, the city I carry around in my head.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gold

quotes.quote: Street lights on fire / Couldn't get much higher / This city never looked so good the way it's lookin' so good on you yeah
quotes.author: Will Weatherly; Hillary Dawn Scott; Dave Haywood; Sara Christine Chrenow; Charles Kelley

quotes.quote: Cause this city is my city / And I love it, yeah I love it / I was born and raised here / I got it made here / And if I have my way, I'm gonna stay here / For life, uh huh
quotes.author: Patrick Stump; Wasalu Jaco

quotes.quote: Hot town, summer in the city / Back of my neck getting dirty and gritty / Been down, isn't it a pity / Doesn't seem to be a shadow in the city
quotes.author: John Sebastian; Mark Sebastian; Steve Boone

quotes.quote: Neon heart, day-glo eyes / The city lit by fireflies / They're advertising in the skies / For people like us
quotes.author: Adam Clayton; Dave Evans; Larry Mullen; Paul Hewson

quotes.quote: Just listen to the music of the traffic in the city, / Linger on the sidewalk where the neon signs are pretty / How can you lose? The lights are much brighter there...
quotes.author: Tony Hatch; James Cauty; Bill Drummond

quotes.quote: I saw at night the City's lights shine bright, / A greater milky way; how in its spell / It fascinated with ten thousand eyes; / Like those sweet wiles of an enchantress who / Would still detain her knight gone cold in love
quotes.author: William Henry Davies

quotes.quote: I saw that City with fierce human surge, / With millions of dark waves that still spread out / To swallow more of their green boundaries.
quotes.author: William Henry Davies

quotes.quote: Beautiful city, the centre and crater of European confusion, / O you with your passionate shriek for the rights of an equal / humanity, / How often your Re-volution has proven but E-volution / Roll’d again back on itself in the tides of a civic insanity!
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: City of orgies, walks and joys! / City whom that I have lived and sung in your midst will one day make / you illustrious,
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.quote: And when the hours of rest / Come, like a calm upon the mid-sea brine, / Hushing its billowy breast — / The quiet of that moment too is thine; / It breathes of him who keeps / The vast and helpless city while it sleeps.
quotes.author: William Cullen Bryant

quotes.quote: Even here do I behold / Thy steps, Almighty! — here, amidst the crowd, / Through the great city rolled, / With everlasting murmur deep and loud — / Choking the ways that wind / 'Mongst the proud piles, the work of humankind.
quotes.author: William Cullen Bryant

quotes.quote: City of twilight, / City that projects into the west, / City whose columns rest upon the sunset, city of square, threatening / masses blocking out the light: / City of twilight, / Wrap me in your folds of shadow.
quotes.author: John Gould Fletcher

quotes.quote: The Beautiful City! Forever / Its rapturous praises resound; / We fain would behold it — but never / A glimpse of its dory is found:
quotes.author: James Whitcomb Riley

quotes.quote: The Beautiful City! O mortal, / Fare hopefully on in thy quest, / Pass down through the green grassy portal / That leads to the Valley of Rest;
quotes.author: James Whitcomb Riley

quotes.quote: You will find no new lands, you will find no other seas. / The city will follow you. You will roam the same / streets. And you will age in the same neighborhoods; / and you will grow gray in these same houses.
quotes.author: Constantine P. Cavafy

quotes.quote: City of God, how broad and far / Outspread thy walls sublime! / The true thy chartered freemen are, / Of every age and clime.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: And from the city comes the chimes — // We have our heaven on earthv — sometimes!
quotes.author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quotes.quote: For one brief golden moment rare like wine, / The gracious city swept across the line;
quotes.author: Claude Mckay

quotes.quote: The great, proud city, seized with a strange love, / Bowed down for one flame hour my pride to prove.
quotes.author: Claude Mckay

quotes.quote: Cities are like puppies. You see them writhing in agony on the street, you put them down. You don't let them suffer.
quotes.author: Damien Darhk

quotes.quote: The city has fallen silent. There is no warmth left in the sun.
quotes.author: Eowyn

quotes.quote: Oh, not the city, sir! Oh, no! It's too bright! I'll go blind!
quotes.author: Hunch

quotes.quote: This city is an open wound begging to be stitched.
quotes.author: Lyle Bolton

quotes.quote: Civil Rights opened the windows. When you open the windows, it does not mean that everybody will get through. We must create our own opportunities.
quotes.author: Mary Frances Berry

quotes.quote: There's no problem on the planet that can't be solved without violence. That's the lesson of the civil rights movement.
quotes.author: Andrew Young

quotes.quote: It is impossible to struggle for civil rights, equal rights for blacks, without including whites. Because equal rights, fair play, justice, are all like the air: we all have it, or none of us has it. That is the truth of it.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Civil rights was not an impossible dream. Thousands of brave African Americans stepped forward to make it happen.
quotes.author: Martin O'Malley

quotes.quote: The Cause of civil liberty must not be surrendered at the end of one, or even one hundred defeats.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: From the equality of rights springs identity of our highest interests; you cannot subvert your neighbor's rights without striking a dangerous blow at your own.
quotes.author: Carl Schurz

quotes.quote: Our civil rights have no dependence on our religious opinions any more than our opinions in physics or geometry...
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Until civil rights are enjoyed by all of us, we're simply not civilized.
quotes.author: Rupert Friend

quotes.quote: The civil rights movement was devoid of grace; it was using some unfortunate people as means to a communistic end.
quotes.author: Samuel Bowers

quotes.quote: When you're fighting for civil rights, it's sometimes two steps forward and one step back. Civil rights are an evolution; and you have to bring people along.
quotes.author: Gloria Allred

quotes.quote: Civil rights used to be about treating everyone the same. But today some people are so used to special treatment that equal treatment is considered to be discrimination.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell

quotes.quote: You could not be in the civil rights movement without having an appreciation for everybody's rights. That these rights are not divisible - not something men have and women don't and so on.
quotes.author: Julian Bond

quotes.quote: The civil rights of none, shall be abridged on account of religious belief or worship, nor shall any national religion be established, nor shall the full and equal rights of conscience be in any manner, or on any pretext infringed.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: In our glorious fight for civil rights, we must guard against being fooled by false slogans, such as 'right-to-work.' It provides no 'rights' and no 'works.' Its purpose is to destroy labor unions and the freedom of collective bargaining"¦. We demand this fraud be stopped.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.quote: The civil rights situation is like a pregnancy. It will get worse, I believe, before it gets better. What the usual pregnancy comes to is a decent baby. That is what we all hope will be the end product of this stress. It is customary, at the end of a pregnancy, to have for your pains a decent baby.
quotes.author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quotes.quote: We must remember that a right lost to one is lost to all.
quotes.author: William Reece Smith, Jr

quotes.quote: One's right to life, liberty, and property depends on the outcome of no election.
quotes.author: Robert H. Jackson

quotes.quote: If you believe in the right to life, then you must believe in the right to have the means to defend that life.
quotes.author: Charley Reese

quotes.quote: The right to life does not depend, and must not be contingent, on the pleasure of anyone else, not even a parent or sovereign.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: As for civil liberties, any one who is not vigilant may one day find himself living, if not in a police state, at least in a police city.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: The civil rights movement didn't begin in Montgomery and it didn't end in the 1960s. It continues on to this very minute.
quotes.author: Julian Bond

quotes.quote: At the foundation of our civil liberties lies the principle that denies to government officials an exceptional position before the law and which subjects them to the same rules of conduct that are commands to the citizen.
quotes.author: Justice Louis D. Brandeis

quotes.quote: Civil liberties victories never stay won, but must be fought for over and over again.
quotes.author: Ira Glasser

quotes.quote: There has been only a civil rights movement, whose tone of voice was adapted to an audience of liberal whites.
quotes.author: Stokely Carmichael

quotes.quote: The civil rights and antiwar movements taught Americans to question authority.
quotes.author: Adam Cohen

quotes.quote: With every civil right there has to be a corresponding civil obligation.
quotes.author: Edison Haines

quotes.quote: Civil rights are more important today than they ever have been in our country. There is so much divisiveness today.
quotes.author: David Harris

quotes.quote: In reality, civil rights are more important than national rights. They're the content, the day-to-day: work, life. But people are sensitive to national rights.
quotes.author: Ayman Odeh

quotes.quote: Civil rights are civil rights. There are no persons who are not entitled to their civil rights. We have to recognize that we have a long way to go, but we have to go that way together.
quotes.author: Dorothy Height

quotes.quote: While on the level of civil rights many things have changed decisively for the better, on the level of attitudes and mentality there's still a long way to go. On the other hand it's obvious that it's much easier to change a law than to change a way of thinking.
quotes.author: Dacia Maraini

quotes.quote: The civil rights movement was based on faith. Many of us who were participants in this movement saw our involvement as an extension of our faith. We saw ourselves doing the work of the Almighty. Segregation and racial discrimination were not in keeping with our faith, so we had to do something.
quotes.author: John Lewis

quotes.quote: We came equals into this world, and equals shall we go out of it.
quotes.author: George Mason

quotes.quote: The right to life is the first among human rights.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: One cannot have a right to life without the right to defend it with deadly force.
quotes.author: Bruce Montague

quotes.quote: Every man has a right to life. That means that he also has a right to make a comfortable living.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The American Civil War produced carnage that has often been thought reserved for the combination of technological proficiency and inhumanity characteristic of a later time.
quotes.author: Drew Gilpin Faust

quotes.quote: With one terrible exception, the Civil War, law and the Constitution have kept America whole and free.
quotes.author: Anthony Lewis

quotes.quote: To a mankind that recognizes the equality of man everywhere, every war becomes a civil war.
quotes.author: Eugen Rosenstock-Huessy

quotes.quote: In your hands, my dissatisfied fellow-countrymen, and not in mine, is the momentous issue of civil war.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: There is no clear or meaningful difference between insurgency and civil war, or between national terrorism and civil war for that matter.
quotes.author: Anthony H. Cordesman

quotes.quote: All wars are civil wars because all men are brothers... Each one owes infinitely more to the human race than to the particular country in which he was born.
quotes.author: Francois Fenelon

quotes.quote: A Union that can only be maintained by swords and bayonets, and in which strife and civil war are to take the place of brotherly love and kindness, has no charm for me.
quotes.author: Robert E. Lee

quotes.quote: The Civil War defined us as what we are and it opened us to being what we became, good and bad things... It was the crossroads of our being, and it was a hell of a crossroads.
quotes.author: Shelby Foote

quotes.quote: Civil wars leave nothing but tombs.
quotes.author: Alphonse De Lamartine

quotes.quote: War, at the best, is terrible, and this war of ours, in its magnitude and in its duration, is one of the most terrible.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: You know, the thing that struck me about Civil War music was how bloody it was; it was full of hatred. There was incredible vitriol in it.
quotes.author: T Bone Burnett

quotes.quote: In every battle there comes a time when both sides consider themselves beaten, then he who continues the attack wins.
quotes.author: Ulysses S. Grant

quotes.quote: War is cruelty. There is no use trying to reform it. The crueler it is, the sooner it will be over.
quotes.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quotes.quote: Causes of Civil War are also, that the wealth of the nation is in too few mens hands, and that no certain means are provided to keep all men from a necessity either to beg, or steal, or be soldiers.
quotes.author: William Petty

quotes.quote: Away with the idea of getting independence first, and looking for liberty afterwards... Our liberties, once lost, may be lost forever.
quotes.author: Alexander H Stephens

quotes.quote: Nothing fills me with deeper sadness than to see a Southerner apologizing for the defense we made of our inheritance.
quotes.author: Jefferson Davis

quotes.quote: War means fighting, and fighting means killing.
quotes.author: Nathan Bedford Forrest

quotes.quote: That in a civil war there is continuous fighting, based on grievences that are forever changing.
quotes.author: Nuruddin Farah

quotes.quote: I can assure you that no kingdom has ever had as many civil wars as the kingdom of Christ.
quotes.author: Montesquieu

quotes.quote: I am quite certain that the crimes of this guilty land will never be purged away but with blood. I had, as I now think vainly, flattered myself that without very much bloodshed it might be done.
quotes.author: John Brown

quotes.quote: Few Americans born after the Civil War know much about war. Real war. War that seeks you out. War that arrives on your doorstep - not once in a blue moon, but once a month or a week or a day.
quotes.author: Nick Turse

quotes.quote: We'll fight them, sir, 'til hell freezes over, and then, sir, we will fight them on the ice.
quotes.author: Shelby Foote

quotes.quote: The civil war which has so long prevailed between Spain and the Provinces in South America still continues, without any prospect of its speedy termination.
quotes.author: James Monroe

quotes.quote: The Civil War has a tremendous moral and emotional force.
quotes.author: Donald McCaig

quotes.quote: It's just like a liberal, they import slaves, they hold slaves, they fight for slavery, they go to war in a civil war to defend slavery. They then install legal discrimination against blacks for a hundred years.
quotes.author: Ann Coulter

quotes.quote: The Civil War was the deadliest war in American history. There were around 210,000 soldiers killed in action and 625,000 total dead.
quotes.author: Baby Professor

quotes.quote: A foreign war is a lot milder than a civil war.
quotes.author: Michael de Montaigne

quotes.quote: In a civil war the firing line is invisible, it passses through the hearts of men.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.quote: The wars of the people will be more terrible than those of the kings.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.quote: If a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
quotes.author: Mark 3:25

quotes.quote: The war of the community—of whole nations, and particularly of civilized nations— always starts from a political condition, and is called forth by a political motive. It is, therefore, a political act.
quotes.author: Karl von Clausewitz

quotes.quote: The war is over— the rebels are our countrymen again.
quotes.author: Ulysses S. Grant

quotes.quote: Now we are engaged in a great civil war, testing whether that nation or any nation so conceived and so dedicated can long endure.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: From hence, let fierce contending nations know / What dire effects from civil discord flow.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: I am not only a pacifist but a militant pacifist. I am willing to fight for peace. Nothing will end war unless the people themselves refuse to go to war.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: In the present civil war—it is quite possible that God's purpose is something different from the purpose of either party— and yet the human instrumentalities, working just as they do, are of the best adaptation to effect his purpose.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: America is a land of big dreamers and big hopes. It is this hope that has sustained us through revolution and civil war, depression and world war, a struggle for civil and social rights and the brink of nuclear crisis.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: In the end no amount of American forces can solve the political differences that lie at the heart of somebody else's civil war.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: The rebellion thus began soon run into the present civil war; and, in certain respects, it began on very unequal terms between the parties. The insurgents had been preparing for it more than thirty years, while the government had taken no steps to resist them
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: This war has to be fought with the scale and duration and savagery that is only true of civil wars.
quotes.author: Newt Gingrich

quotes.quote: We have overcome some terrible blows to our democracy, to the future of our democracy, to the future of our nation. We survived the Civil War and the strife that tore this nation apart.
quotes.author: Walter Cronkite

quotes.quote: The United States needed a civil war to unite properly.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.quote: Civil war? What does that mean? Is there any foreign war? Isn't every war fought between men, between brothers?
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: The question of what actually caused the Civil War is secondary to the result of the Civil War, which is that after the war was over, slavery was ended, and the North and the South reconciled. And I think we need to respect that.
quotes.author: Corey Stewart

quotes.quote: The greatest curse that can befall a free people, is civil war.
quotes.author: Alexander H. Stephens

quotes.quote: It's just like a liberal, they import slaves, they hold slaves, they fight for slavery, they go to war in a civil war to defend slavery. They then install legal discrimination against blacks for a hundred years.
quotes.author: Ann Coulter

quotes.quote: Civil wars leave nothing but tombs.
quotes.author: Alphonse De Lamartine

quotes.quote: Virtually all of Africa's civil wars were started by politically marginalized or excluded groups.
quotes.author: George Ayittey

quotes.quote: Americans in the Civil War period were very interested in Heaven and what it might be like, because they were having to face the fact that many of their loved ones were gone and many of their loved ones, they hoped, were in this other realm called Heaven.
quotes.author: Drew Gilpin Faust

quotes.quote: I know why we lost the Civil War. We must have had the same officials.
quotes.author: Bum Philips

quotes.quote: There is neither a foreign war nor a civil war; there is only just and unjust war.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Most civil wars, in fact, end quite badly, and history is rife with lessons that how wars end is every bit as crucial as why they start and how they are waged.
quotes.author: Jay Winik

quotes.quote: Every action done in company ought to be with some sign of respect to those that are present.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: Civility sometimes requires polite ruthlessness. Establish that what you prize most is civility.
quotes.author: Jimmy Bise Jr

quotes.quote: Civility is not a tactic or a sentiment. It is the determined choice of trust over cynicism, of community over chaos.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: When civility is illusory, war is inevitable.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: Civility is not something that automatically happens. Civil societies come about because people want them to.
quotes.author: Jimmy Bise Jr

quotes.quote: Civility, politeness, it's like a cement in a society: binds it together. And when we lose it, then I think we all feel lesser and slightly dirty because of it.
quotes.author: Jeremy Irons

quotes.quote: Civility, it is said, means obeying the unenforceable.
quotes.author: Ellen Goodman

quotes.quote: There can be no high civility without a deep morality, though it may not always call itself by that name.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Certainly every man can be courteous, for it costs nothing, and is within the ability of all.
quotes.author: Nicias Ballard Cooksey

quotes.quote: Politeness is the art of choosing among your thoughts.
quotes.author: Madame De Stael

quotes.quote: The civility of no race can be perfect whilst another race is degraded.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Courtesies of a small and trivial character are the ones which strike deepest in the grateful and appreciating heart.
quotes.author: Henry Clay

quotes.quote: Civility costs nothing, and buys everything.
quotes.author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quotes.quote: Civility is a work of the imagination, for it is through the imagination that we render others sufficiently like ourselves for them to become subjects of tolerance and respect, if not always affection.
quotes.author: Benjamin Barber

quotes.quote: Civility is the natural state for people who know how limited their own individual powers are and know, too, that they need the conversation.
quotes.author: David Brooks

quotes.quote: Civility is the art and act of caring for others.
quotes.author: Deborah King

quotes.quote: Courtesy in the world is by no means a false and culpable pretense. It softens rather than dissimulates; and, on the whole, since it deceives nobody, it cannot be accused of falsehood.
quotes.author: Madame Swetchine

quotes.quote: Aspire to decency. Practice civility toward one another. Admire and emulate ethical behavior wherever you find it. Apply a rigid standard of morality to your lives; and if, periodically, you fail Â­ as you surely will Â­ adjust your lives, not the standards.
quotes.author: Ted Koppel

quotes.quote: The civility of the world has reached that pitch that their more moral genius is becoming indispensable, and the quality of this race is to be honored for itself.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerso

quotes.quote: The very essence of politeness seems to be to take care by our words and actions we make other people pleased with us as well as with themselves.
quotes.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.quote: Civility is perhaps a quaint notion but civility in Parliament is something we should always strive to uphold.
quotes.author: Jay Weatherill

quotes.quote: Courtesy is as much a mark of a gentleman as courage
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Manners are a sensitive awareness of the feelings of others. If you have that awareness, you have good manners, no matter what fork you use.
quotes.author: Emily Post

quotes.quote: Civility is not simply about manners.
quotes.author: Jim Leach

quotes.quote: Civility isn't just some optional value in a multicultural, multistate democratic republic. Civility is the key to civilization.
quotes.author: Van Jones

quotes.quote: Courtesy is only a thin veneer on the general selfishness.
quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.quote: Civility does not mean the mere outward gentleness of speech cultivated for the occasion, but an inborn gentleness and desire to do the opponent good.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: We have gotten so use to humor being something nasty and offensive that we started to believe that was the only way to get a laugh.
quotes.author: John Patrick Hickey

quotes.quote: All of civility depends on being able to contain the rage of individuals.
quotes.author: Joshua Lederberg

quotes.quote: There is a courtesy of the heart; it is allied to love. From its springs the purest courtesy in the outward behavior.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Civility awareness and a common foundation of considerate conduct are crutial to our future,
quotes.author: Cindy Ann Peterson

quotes.quote: No matter who it is or what you think of them, never rejoice in the pain of others. It lowers you to a level you should not be at.
quotes.author: John Patrick Hickey

quotes.quote: Courtesy is a debt we all owe to humanity.
quotes.author: Nicias Ballard Cooksey

quotes.quote: When once the forms of civility are violated, there remains little hope of return to kindness or decency.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Be civil to all; serviceable to many; familiar with few; friend to one; enemy to none.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Civility is not about dousing strongly held views. It's about making sure that people are willing to respect other perspectives.
quotes.author: Jim Leach

quotes.quote: Civility is a charm that attracts the love of all men.
quotes.author: George Horne

quotes.quote: Civility is not a specific code of behavior as much as it is a call to unrelenting preemptive thought, and steady effort to care about influence on others.
quotes.author: John R. Dallas Jr

quotes.quote: The civility which money will purchase, is rarely extended to those who have none.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Civility is not not saying negative or harsh things. It is not the absence of critical analysis. It is the manner in which we are sharing this territorial freedom of political discussion. If our discourse is yelled and screamed and interrupted and patronized, that's uncivil.
quotes.author: Richard Dreyfuss

quotes.quote: Politeness and civility are the best capital ever invested in business
quotes.author: P. T. Barnum

quotes.quote: Don't ever forget that you're a citizen of this world, and there are things you can do to lift the human spirit, things that are easy, things that are free, things that you can do every day: civility, respect, kindness, character.
quotes.author: Aaron Sorkin

quotes.quote: We need to create a society in which civility rules over cynicism and apathy
quotes.author: Antanas Mockus

quotes.quote: I am the eternal optimist. I think that, over time, people respond to civility and rational argument.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: The great thing about civility is that it does not require you to agree with or approve of anything. You don't even have to love your neighbor to be civil. You just have to treat your neighbor the same way you would like your neighbor to treat your grandmother, or your child.
quotes.author: Barbara Brown Taylor

quotes.quote: You ultimately judge the civility of a society not by how it treats the rich, the powerful, the protected, and the highly esteemed, but by how it treats the poor, the disfavored, and the disadvantaged.
quotes.author: Bryan Stevenson

quotes.quote: Today we affirm a new commitment to live out our nation's promise through civility, courage, compassion, and character.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: Speak not injurious words neither in jest nor earnest; scoff at none, although they give occasion.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: Gratitude is the beginning of civility, of decency and goodness, of a recognition that we cannot afford to be arrogant. We should walk with the knowledge that we will need help every step of the way.
quotes.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.quote: I am worn out with civility. I have been talking incessantly all night, and with nothing to say. But with you there may be peace. You will not want to be talked to. Let us have the luxury of silence.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Treating people fairly and with civility is not a bad thing. It would be good for our country if political leaders actually took that to heart.
quotes.author: Jeb Bush

quotes.quote: So let us begin anew remembering on both sides that civility is not a sign of weakness, and sincerity is always subject to proof. Let us never negotiate out of fear, but let us never fear to negotiate. Let both sides explore what problems unite us instead of belaboring those problems which divide us.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: People who expect deference resent mere civility.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Civility means a great deal more than just being nice to one another. It is complex and encompasses learning how to connect successfully and live well with others, developing thoughtfulness, and fostering effective self-expression and communication. Civility includes courtesy, politeness, mutual respect, fairness, good manners, as well as a matter of good health. Taking an active interest in the well-being of our community and concern for the health of our society is also involved in civility.
quotes.author: P. M. Forni

quotes.quote: Teaching civility is an obligation of the family.
quotes.author: Stephen Carter

quotes.quote: Civilization is a limitless multiplication of unnecessary necessities.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Civilization in its present form hasn't got long.
quotes.author: James Lovelock

quotes.quote: Every civilization depends on the quality of the individuals it produces. If you over-organize humans, over-legalize them, suppress their urge to greatness, they cannot work and their civilization collapses
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: A civilization that only looks inward will stagnate. We have to keep looking outward; we have to keep finding new avenues for human endeavor and human expression.
quotes.author: John L. Phillips

quotes.quote: Civilization begins with order, grows with liberty, and dies with chaos.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.quote: Primitiveness and civilization are degrees of the same thing. If civilization has an opposite, it is war.
quotes.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition, a voyage and not a harbor.
quotes.author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quotes.quote: Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: Civilization exists by geological consent, subject to change without notice.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.quote: Every civilization is, among other things, an arrangement for domesticating the passions and setting them to do useful work.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Civilization is nothing more than the effort to reduce the use of force to the last resort.
quotes.author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset

quotes.quote: Civilization sails prettily like a child's rubber balloon until it hits a sharp object; then it is likely to collapse like the balloon.
quotes.author: Austin O'Malley

quotes.quote: Civilization rests on a set of promises; if the promises are broken too often, the civilization dies, no matter how rich it may be, or how mechanically clever. Hope and faith depend on the promises; if hope and faith go, everything goes.
quotes.author: Herbert

quotes.quote: Civilization has developed executive powers far beyond its understanding.
quotes.author: Maude Meagher

quotes.quote: The test of civilization is the estimate of women.
quotes.author: George William Curtis

quotes.quote: Technical civilization has made a great error in not suppressing death, the only human reality still intact.
quotes.author: Jacques Ellul

quotes.quote: Human civilization is not something achieved against nature; it is rather the outcome of the working of the innate qualities of man.
quotes.author: Ludwig Von Mises

quotes.quote: Civilizations die from philosophical calm, irony, and a sense of fair play quite as surely as they die of debauchery.
quotes.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quotes.quote: Civilization is the world with its leg asleep.
quotes.author: Austin O'Malley

quotes.quote: Civilization is the way one's own people live. Savagery is the way foreigners live.
quotes.author: Octavia Butler

quotes.quote: No civilization other than that which is Christian, is worth seeking or possessing.
quotes.author: Otto von Bismarck

quotes.quote: You know, our sense of individuality is just the number one target of civilization.
quotes.author: Alan Rudolph

quotes.quote: Civilization is the process in which one gradually increases the number of people included in the term 'we' or 'us' and at the same time decreases those labeled 'you' or 'them' until that category has no one left in it.
quotes.author: Howie Winter

quotes.quote: A civilization begins to decline the moment Life becomes its sole obsession.
quotes.author: Emil Cioran

quotes.quote: Civilization, to be worthy of the name, must afford other methods of settling human differences than those of blood letting.
quotes.author: Ralph Chaplin

quotes.quote: Civilization is the progress toward a society of privacy. The savage's whole existence is public, ruled by the laws of his tribe. Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: We will never have true civilization until we have learned to recognize the rights of others.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Civilization is a progress from an indefinite, incoherent homogeneity toward a definite, coherent heterogeneity.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.quote: A great civilization is not conquered from without until it has destroyed itself within.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.quote: Civilization grew in the beginning from the minute that we had communication - particularly communication by sea that enabled people to get inspiration and ideas from each other and to exchange basic raw materials.
quotes.author: Thor Heyerdahl

quotes.quote: Civilizations can only be understood by those who are civilized.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: A civilization in which there is not a continuous controversy about important issues is on the way to totalitarianism and death.
quotes.author: Robert Maynard Hutchins

quotes.quote: The luxuries of civilization satisfy only those wants which they themselves create.
quotes.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard

quotes.quote: Civilization is not necessary before Christianity; do both together if you will, but you will find civilization follow Christianity more easily than Christianity follow civilization.
quotes.author: Samuel Marsden

quotes.quote: A modern civilization is only possible when it is accepted that singular beings exist and express themselves freely.
quotes.author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quotes.quote: Civilization runs a greater risk if we maintain our present attitude to religion than if we give it up.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: Civilization advances by extending the number of important operations which we can perform without thinking of them.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: Civilization is a method of living, an attitude of equal respect for all men.
quotes.author: Jane Addams

quotes.quote: Civilization is a conspiracy. Modern life is the silent compact of comfortable folk to keep up pretences.
quotes.author: John Buchan

quotes.quote: Civilization is the process of reducing the infinite to the finite.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Our civilization has evolved through the continuous adjustment of society to the stimulus of new knowledge.
quotes.author: John Boyd Orr

quotes.quote: Human civilization has been no more than a strange luminescence growing more intense by the hour, of which no one can say when it will begin to wane and when it will fade away.
quotes.author: W.G. Sebald

quotes.quote: Every civilization sees itself as the center of the world and writes its history as the central drama of human history.
quotes.author: Samuel P. Huntington

quotes.quote: A general definition of civilization: a civilized society is exhibiting the fine qualities of truth, beauty, adventure, art, peace.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: Civilization is the order and freedom is promoting cultural activity.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.quote: Civilization is unbearable, but it is less unbearable at the top.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: Civilization began the first time an angry person cast a word instead of a rock.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: Civilization rests on the fact that most people do the right thing most of the time.
quotes.author: Dean Koontz

quotes.quote: Once in a while you get a moment of clarity an inspiration and they don't come that frequently.
quotes.author: Paul Reiser

quotes.quote: It's a lack of clarity that creates chaos and frustration. Those emotions are poison to any living goal.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: Mystification is simple; clarity is the hardest thing of all.
quotes.author: Julian Barnes

quotes.quote: There are few things more powerful than a life lived with passionate clarity.
quotes.author: Erwin McManus

quotes.quote: Having knowledge but lacking the power to express it clearly is no better than never having any ideas at all.
quotes.author: Pericles

quotes.quote: Seeking Clarity is seeking connection with the universe. To connect is to understand; to be clear is to be enlightened.
quotes.author: Annie Zalezsak

quotes.quote: Perfect clarity would profit the intellect but damage the will.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: A lack of clarity could put the brakes on any journey to success.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: You get clarity as you get sober, and you get clarity as you get older.
quotes.author: Nikki Sixx

quotes.quote: A few times in my life I've had moments of clarity where the silence drowns out the noise and I can feel rather than think.
quotes.author: Tom Ford

quotes.quote: Clarity is the counterbalance of profound thoughts.
quotes.author: Luc De Clapiers

quotes.quote: We see in order to move; we move in order to see.
quotes.author: William Gibson

quotes.quote: I had a moment of clarity, saw the feeling in the heart of things, walked out to the garden crying.
quotes.author: Allen Ginsberg

quotes.quote: The beauty is that through disappointment you can gain clarity, and with clarity comes conviction and true originality.
quotes.author: Conan O'Brien

quotes.quote: Clarify what you are for, not against. This is true power.
quotes.author: Annie Zalezsak

quotes.quote: You must first clearly see a thing in your mind before you can do it.
quotes.author: Alex Morrison

quotes.quote: When people will not weed their own minds, they are apt to be overrun by nettles.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.quote: For me the greatest beauty always lies in the greatest clarity.
quotes.author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quotes.quote: Although our intellect always longs for clarity and certainty, our nature often finds uncertainty fascinating.
quotes.author: Karl von Clausewitz

quotes.quote: I look at the human life like an experiment. Every new moment, every new experience, tragic or otherwise, is an opportunity to gain a more accurate perspective and helps lead me to clarity.
quotes.author: Steve Gleason

quotes.quote: When the meaning is unclear there is no meaning.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: Clarity, clarity, surely clarity is the most beautiful thing in the world, a limited, limiting clarity I have not and never did have any motive of poetry, but to achieve clarity.
quotes.author: George Oppen

quotes.quote: A 20/20 mindset produces clarity, joy, and peace in your life. It produces results.
quotes.author: Farshad Asl

quotes.quote: For those who confuse you, recognize that their confusion is theirs and your clarity is yours.
quotes.author: Barbara Marciniak

quotes.quote: You must read, you must persevere, you must sit up nights, you must inquire, and exert the utmost power of your mind. If one way does not lead to the desired meaning, take another; if obstacles arise, then still another; until, if your strength holds out, you will find that clear which at first looked dark.
quotes.author: Giovanni Boccaccio

quotes.quote: Every loss recapitulates earlier losses, but every affirmation of identity echoes earlier moments of clarity.
quotes.author: Mary Catherine Bateson

quotes.quote: Clarity is the most important thing. I can compare clarity to pruning in gardening. You know, you need to be clear. If you are not clear, nothing is going to happen. You have to be clear. Then you have to be confident about your vision. And after that, you just have to put a lot of work in.
quotes.author: Diane Von Furstenberg

quotes.quote: He had a moment of clarity about how life should be lived: not as a child or as a woman. They were the two worst things to be.
quotes.author: Alice Sebold

quotes.quote: Clarity keeps you from boredom.
quotes.author: Kim Basinger

quotes.quote: When things feel murky and unsure, fine tuning our hearing so as to distinguish the voice of our Innermost Self brings clarity.
quotes.author: Kristi Bowman

quotes.quote: I honour the clarity of the present moment, and the stillness at the centre of being mine & others, even in the midst of so much doing.
quotes.author: Jay Woodman

quotes.quote: If you can simply drop yourself from the moment, you can still experience life and with more clarity.
quotes.author: Roshan Sharma

quotes.quote: More important than the quest for certainty is the quest for clarity.
quotes.author: Francois Gautier

quotes.quote: Clear thinking at the wrong moment can stifle creativity.
quotes.author: Karl Lagerfeld

quotes.quote: Clarity and focus doesn't always come from God or inspirational quotes. Usually, it takes your mother to slap the reality back into you.
quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.quote: The more of me I be, the clearer I can see.
quotes.author: Rachel Archelaus

quotes.quote: A solid answer to everything is not necessary. Blurry concepts influence one to focus, but postulated clarity influences arrogance.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz

quotes.quote: Clarity and peace of mind are powerful tools. Achieving either and both is only possible when we allow ourselves to see life in all its variance.
quotes.author: Carlos Wallace

quotes.quote: Clarity of mind means clarity of passion, too; this is why a great and clear mind loves ardently and sees distinctly what he loves.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: When the defects of others are perceived with so much clarity, it is because one possesses them oneself.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.quote: Clarity affords focus.
quotes.author: Thomas Leonard

quotes.quote: In the kingdom of glass everything is transparent, and there is no place to hide a dark heart.
quotes.author: Vera Nazarian

quotes.quote: Everyone must have a voice, and everyone deserves clarity.
quotes.author: Kevin Plank

quotes.quote: One should use common words to say uncommon things.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: Everyone sees the unseen in proportion to the clarity of his heart, and that depends upon how much he has polished it. Whoever has polished it more sees more, more unseen forms become manifest to him.
quotes.author: Jalal ad-Din Rumi

quotes.quote: You explore every avenue and possibility of your situation at high speed with total clarity.
quotes.author: Banksy

quotes.quote: People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. Live your truth and don't ever stop!
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: Those who know that they are profound strive for clarity. Those who would like to seem profound to the crowd strive for obscurity. For the crowd believes that if it cannot see to the bottom of something it must be profound. It is so timid and dislikes going into the water.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The more you go with the flow of life and surrender the outcome to God, and the less you seek constant clarity, the more you will find that fabulous thing start to show up in your life.
quotes.author: Mandy Hale

quotes.quote: A lack of clarity could put the brakes on any journey to success.
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: The best way to succeed is to have a specific Intent, a clear Vision, a plan of Action, and the ability to maintain Clarity. Those are the Four Pillars of Success. It never fails!
quotes.author: Steve Maraboli

quotes.quote: What you are, and who you are should provide greater clarity about where you have been and where you are headed.
quotes.author: T.F. Hodge

quotes.quote: Colors shone with exceptional clarity in the rain.
quotes.author: Haruki Murakami

quotes.quote: Clarity is the secret. Clarity is the weapon. Make it clear. See it happening. Make it clear. See it becoming.
quotes.author: Aisha S. Kingu

quotes.quote: Clarity, a successful man's reason. Clarity, an ambitious man's weapon.
quotes.author: Aisha S. Kingu

quotes.quote: When clarity is in the category. It’s the best choice to have on strategy. For clarity gives guidance, and grows confidence.
quotes.author: Aisha S. Kingu

quotes.quote: Clarity emerge when focus is engaged.
quotes.author: Anesu Masamba

quotes.quote: Like a diamond, the more clarity we have, the more value we bring.
quotes.author: Ruth Saw

quotes.quote: A simple life gives birth to more clarity, inner peace and meaningful relationships.
quotes.author: Margo Vader

quotes.quote: In my life I have had several moments of total clarity.
quotes.author: Ella Risbridger

quotes.quote: Clarity of mind is peace, nowhere else can peace be sought and found.
quotes.author: J.R. Incer

quotes.quote: That is because one must proceed from clarity, and the smallest element of miscalculation produces fantasy, and fantasy produces beauty.
quotes.author: Yukio Mishima

quotes.quote: Clarity is the key to unlock your potential.
quotes.author: Ruth Saw

quotes.quote: Clarity comes from within.
quotes.author: Ruth Saw

quotes.quote: Clarity trumps positive affirmations.
quotes.author: Ruth Saw

quotes.quote: Inaction is just a sign of the lack of clarity.
quotes.author: Ruth Saw

quotes.quote: To live a harmonious life, all you need is clarity of mind.
quotes.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

quotes.quote: At some point in their lives, each one of us requires mentoring, guidance and counsel to get better clarity on our vision, passions, goals, and life in general.
quotes.author: Dr Prem Jagyasi

quotes.quote: Clarity does not always comes with experience. It does come with knowledge, with a proper state of mind. That is why the importance of meditation and literature can not be under emphasised.
quotes.author: Harshit Walia

quotes.quote: Out of calmness comes clarity.
quotes.author: Trevor Carss

quotes.quote: A man with clarity reaches his goal sooner than the man with confidence.
quotes.author: Amit Kalantri

quotes.quote: Dear God, let us find clarity in our moments of doubt, and may the unmistakable truth find its way to our lips.
quotes.author: Ron Baratono

quotes.quote: Clarity of execution; and the goodness of the heart for the cause.
quotes.author: Alan Maiccon

quotes.quote: True clarity comes only from the senses.
quotes.author: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: It has always been the regular state of things. There is no clarity, no relief.
quotes.author: Ken Liu

quotes.quote: I knew that I could not possibly teach; the energy and clarity that teaching requires, which I'd always taken for granted, were gone.
quotes.author: Elaine Pagels

quotes.quote: You’ve reach the point of clarity in life. There’s salvation knowing Jesus has his hands on your heart.
quotes.author: Ron Baratono

quotes.quote: Find clarity in the stillness.
quotes.author: Akiroq Brost

quotes.quote: Clarity attracts and confusion repels.
quotes.author: Kary Oberbrunner

quotes.quote: Clarity is that 20/20 focus that cuts through the fog and lets you stand our from the noise. Clarity fuels effective marketing and selling.
quotes.author: Steve Woodruff

quotes.quote: The ecstasy of the moment will, I believe, lead the way to the terribly elusive clarity I seek.
quotes.author: Harry N. MacLean

quotes.quote: Clarity is an act of courage to say "yes" to the best business - and therefore to decisively say "no" to work that isn't a good fit.
quotes.author: Steve Woodruff

quotes.quote: The understanding of our position, clarity of the direction, and effectiveness of our actions determine the height of our destination.
quotes.author: Farshad Asl

quotes.quote: You cannot decide to try any matter that even you are unsure about its clarity, the visible outlook may excite one to take the step to move forward that success is predictable.
quotes.author: Ehsan Sehgal

quotes.quote: Thinking more deeply into things usually left alone helps us to find bubbles of truth and clarity.
quotes.author: Kayla Severson

quotes.quote: Clarity comes from action, not thought.
quotes.author: Marie Forleo

quotes.quote: The kind of clarity crazy people demand from the not-crazy.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.quote: Warriors win battles, not by ignoring them, but through clarity.
quotes.author: Théun Mares

quotes.quote: How relationships unfold with the most important people in our lives depends on courage and clarity in finding voice.
quotes.author: Harriet Lerner

quotes.quote: Spirituality gives clarity and clarity gives power to changed anything in life.
quotes.author: Vidya Yedavalli

quotes.quote: The path towards spiritual clarity brings many questions, but all you need to remember is that everything is happening exactly as it should.
quotes.author: Dee Waldeck

quotes.quote: Your actions show what you know, and your replies to obstacles give clarity into what you will learn.
quotes.author: Grace Sara

quotes.quote: Clarity and simplicity help us to build confidence; keep things clear and keep them simple.
quotes.author: Sam Owen

quotes.quote: Confidence brings comfort and clarity.
quotes.author: Debasish Mridha

quotes.quote: When you know your role in life, living makes sense because of clarity, and the loads become enjoyable to carry.
quotes.author: Innocent Mwatsikesimbe

quotes.quote: Clarity repositions you to quit nice activities that take you nowhere in order to pursue risky tasks that take you somewhere.
quotes.author: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.quote: Having clarity on where you want to go is one of the most critical components of your life.
quotes.author: Michael Hyatt

quotes.quote: When speaking hope that clarity is found in your message even when it's not accepted.
quotes.author: Tyconis D. Allison Ty

quotes.quote: It will not bring clarity; it will only bring more complexity. That is why the yogis looked in a different direction. We looked inward. If you look inward, a different dimension opens up. Now instead of things getting more complex, you get to clarity. It is because of this that we say that those who look inward have a third eye. They see things that others cannot see. They have brought a new clarity to life.
quotes.author: Jaggi Vasudev

quotes.quote: When you confront, you live in clarity.
quotes.author: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.quote: A few steps back is sometimes needed to find clarity in the confusion.
quotes.author: April Mae Monterrosa

quotes.quote: Clarity is like casting light. Clarity allows us to see better and eases the path of understanding.
quotes.author: Cyrus Panjvani

quotes.quote: Clarity and peace in any relationship helps people to grow and evolve as an individual and as a better human beings.
quotes.author: Megha Khare

quotes.quote: Relaxations increase our joy and we need meditations for inner peace and clarity
quotes.author: Kishore Bansal

quotes.quote: There is more clarity in paradoxical truths, than there is in a single act of bold stupidity.
quotes.author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau

quotes.quote: More than the clarity we need to have about what must change, we need to have even more clarity about what must not change.
quotes.author: Assegid Habtewold

quotes.quote: The journey to fulfilment becomes less scary once there is a clarity of purpose.
quotes.author: Bidemi Mark-Mordi

quotes.quote: There is greater clarity in the still waters of sadness, something not found in the babbling brooks of more sought after emotions.
quotes.author: Shaun Hick

quotes.quote: On the still calm waters of surrender, the reflections of clarity appear.
quotes.author: Bryant McGill

quotes.quote: Sometimes spending the night on the bathroom floor brings clarity to an otherwise cloudy situation.
quotes.author: Jewel E. Ann

quotes.quote: By choosing to have a calm response to what seems negative you bring clarity and balance to your message.
quotes.author: Bryant McGill

quotes.quote: We teach best by how we live life; who we are instructs with absolute clarity.
quotes.author: Bryant McGill
